alert.note: Alert for Butler; Covington; Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 8:12PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Butler, Covington and Crenshaw. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms producing very heavy across southern Butler, far southwestern Crenshaw, and far northern Covington counties in south central Alabama. 1 to 2 inches of rain is estimated to have quickly fallen during the past hour and additional heavy rainfall may result in minor flooding of creeks and streams, local roadways, and other low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Georgiana, McKenzie, Dozier, Industry, Oaky Streak, Shell, Brushy Creek, Avant, East Chapman, Chapman, Mulberry, Merrill Mill, Leon and Searight. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
